content.description: Same sit start as Backbacks V0+ and you traverse over to the right. Very small feet and razor sharp crimps you find your way to hooking the arete right your right foot as you match the sloper. Top out at the main horn where you can stand up, traverse over to Badbacks and come down using the route as a down climb.
content.location: Near the top of the main dome, two large boulders stand on their own. Take the normal summit trail up and you'll be able to spot them to your far left.

content.description: Climb the slopey arete on the right side of the uphill boulder. Best downclimb is either using the slab or hanging off the top and dropping off.
Incut crimps on a slightly overhanging arete. Careful choosing feet especially near the top. Get down via the slab next to Negative Edge. Cool line, wish the rock was better.
content.location: On Lunar boulder, left of Negative Edge. On the main dome closer to the slope leading to Echo Canyon. I just started walking from the top towards the canyon. Hard to miss.

content.description: There is a low sit start with a left heel that makes it a V0+ there is also a mid start that is just a V0. Down climb will be same as the route going up. There is a right hand undwrcling that helps you stand up. Also, a right hand crimp to pull yourself to a top out.
content.location: Near the top of the main dome, two large boulders stand on their own. Take the normal summit trail up and you'll be able to spot them to your far left.

content.description: Tends to have a lot of people passing by because it's so close to the main trail up to the top of the main dome. It's far enough away that it's not too bad though.
